Payment conditions | Zahlung Payment can be done by bank transfer (my banking account is in Germany) oder by payment via Paypal (buyers are asked to use the friends & family option, otherwise the buyer has to add the paypal fees). | Zahlung per berweisung oder per Paypal (bitte friends & family Option, ansonsten trgt der Kufer bzw. die Kuferin zustzlich die Paypal-Gebhr).

boardgame.name: Xboat (No. 4 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Xboat!

This is a science fiction fanzine, with most of the material suggested by fans who love Traveller. It's about discussion, example, and bold ideas.

Great Content...

Each issue is 24 half-pages (5.5 x 8.5). Xboat No. 4 includes these articles:


A Starship (the Hopper-Bastien scout/courier) profiled and illustrated to inspire.
Character generation notes on merchant captain Alexander Lascelles Jamison.
Aliens: the Fhinetorow, an engimatic sophont people.
Two robots: one for security, the other a valet.
Utility-Unit Armor.
A world profile, with some local fauna and native intelligent life.


...and more.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Artificial Persons: Security and Valet Robots
Feature: Revisiting Merchant Alexander Jamison for Traveller5

boardgame.name: Parsifal: A Game of Tarots
boardgame.description:
Parsifal - A Game of Tarots is a fierce and engaging game that breaks the mold by reinterpreting Richard Wagner’s opera with a fantasy twist through 30 tarots (23 characters and 7 artifacts).

In Parsifal - A Game of Tarots you will find a high level of strategic interdependence: each player controls multiple characters and, at each turn, they must choose which tarot to play with to win.

Each character has their missions to accomplish: you will only win when one of your characters completes them all.
Artifacts make the game even more exciting and deep: these are precious and dangerous tools, which can turn around the outcome of a game!

Choose your strategy at each turn and tackle the three mandatory imperatives to heed the call: Desire, Despair, Duty.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #21)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the 21st issue of The Glatisant, Questing Beast’s free monthly newsletter.

Knave: Second Edition
Reviews
Rules and Game Design
News
Theory and Advice
Worldbuilding
History
Podcasts

boardgame.name: Blood-Forging: Arms and Armor that Evolve
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Image a weapon that only responds to your hand. Armor that grows stronger as you do. Arms and armor with strange and unique abilities inherently tied to who you are. This is Blood-Forging, a rare artform practiced by the most elite craftspeople in the lands.

This supplement introduces the Blood-Forging feat, which allows master crafters to create Blood-Forged items. All Blood-Forged items gain enhancement bonuses based on the owner's total character levels, growing in power alongside their owners. In addition, each Blood-Forged item also possesses a set of unique abilities: one that unlocks when first acquired, one that grows stronger the longer it is used, and one Actualization ability that unlocks after it has been owned for five levels. The supplement includes over 40 examples of Blood-Forged weapons and armor, but players and GMs can use this supplement to come up with their own ideas as well.

In addition, this supplement includes story seeds to help GMs introduce this powerful new equipment into their campaigns. These seeds include four NPC master crafters that can teach the Blood-Forging feat to players, or craft Blood-Forged weapons and armor for them.

boardgame.name: Maps for Fantasy RPGs 2
Maps for Fantasy RPGs II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laidback DM's Maps for Fantasy RPGs 2 is a collection of 20 hand-drawn, full color maps (2 zip files of 100 digital image files, in CMYK Print format, RGB Screen format, full size A3 & A4 grid and grid-less and grid-less VTT size). These maps come with a limited commercial license allowing you, the purchaser, to use them royalty-free in your own commercial or private publication projects.

Dungeons, haunted houses, temples, ruins, lairs, tombs, wilderness and more! All map images are high quality 600DPI (print quality is 300DPI) full color JPEGS and are unlabeled, so you can add your own as needed.

These maps are system-neutral and can be used with any fantasy game.

boardgame.name: Sorcerous Origin: Riot Born
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Shortsighted bastards thought they could die and get away from me. I’ll hunt them all the way across the fields of Hirakhal to the hot iron gates of the hells. You tell the others the drinks are on me when they get there.”
- Last words of Noja Ravati, as recorded by Kori Ravati.

Tyranny, no matter the mask it wears or the weapon it wields, is a disgusting and aberrant thing. Whether it comes in the form of a single individual reigning coldly and maliciously over a populous, a religious organization spreading hateful doctrine across a countryside under their control, or from a cabal of individuals set on dominating all souls that their hidden tendrils touch, the effects of tyranny are always heartbreaking and dire. But beneath the heel of these oppressors, rebellion stirs among the common people and can culminate in something truly miraculous. Sometimes these feelings of frustration and anger can boil over and give birth to a revolution. And sometimes, they can bring forth a Riot Born.

Riot Born sorcerers are the embodiment of the righteous fury and desperation of the disenfranchised, endowed with arcane abilities tailor-made to blow back their persecutors and reclaim the spaces and rights that were taken from them by the established powers of their realms. Some Riot Born spring up among the ranks of freedom fighters in the midst of widespread civil unrest, ready to follow their comrades into the war awaiting them on the horizon. Others arise as the result of a thousand silent cries and unspoken prayers, ready to shoulder the burden of their birthright and be the first to light the spark of rebellion among their people.

This supplement includes:

The Riot Born sorcerer archetype.
2 new metamagic options
Battering Spell
Inciting Spell

boardgame.name: Misunderstood Mammals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scattered around the world are many humanoids who resemble various misunderstood mammals. These anthropomorphic adventurers have just begun to spread around the world and need your help to achieve their goals. Join nine new lineages from the armored dasydan to the shy thylacan await.

boardgame.name: Adventure Sandbox 05
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Sandboxes are a location with a map. Suggested hooks could give characters a reason to visit. You'll also find information about NPCs, geographic features, and situations for your players to discover.

Please note: a Sandbox is a location with details for players to discover and interact with. Sandboxes are game sytem neutral, meaning you can use almost any system you like to run a game there.

This 4-page Sandbox covers Oakwall, a small town in the Rashnam Forest. Characters can discover The Wailing Waif, run by Gardella Goodnettle; Peevus, the halfling that runs a brothel and gambling house; a farmer who grows (what may be) magic pipeleaf, and much more. You'll get access to 4 NPCs, PLUS: labeled and unlabeled maps of Oakwall which you can print or use on a VTT.

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 17
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes these citizens of the town of Oakwall, deep inside the Rashnam Forest:

Gardella Goodnettle - female halfling innkeeper
Goodman Moddington - male human farmer
Kellida Laughingbrook - female half-elf blacksmith
Peevus - male halfling brothel manager

boardgame.name: Terror in Port Dakala
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hello Bone Ponies! Welcome to the land of Drakuva, A world of high fantasy, powerful magic, mighty heroes and dreadful villains. Drakuva is the setting location for most of Tabletop Totality’s published adventures. Drakuva itself has a long and cataclysmic history but perhaps the most important event in recorded history is the Ruination of the Dwarves.

For this adventure module, Port Dakala is the setting location for all four adventures contained within and the common factor between these missions. This means that while each mission might have some overlapping information or Characters, each adventure can be played on its own or the entire module can be easily modified into a full campaign. Our goal at Tabletop Totality is to provide enough of a story and lore that each adventure can stand on its own and also remain flexible enough in our descriptions and information that The Overlord (master of rules, storyteller, etc) can easily modify the adventures to fit their needs and the needs of their Party.

For this particular module, Tabletop Totality had Halloween in mind and so we wished to create adventures that could easily be plugged into any Dark Fantasy/Horror campaign but with effort taken to remain user friendly and appeal to a more diverse background. Contained within these pages are various villains and terrible monsters of our own creation. There are handcrafted spells, powerful weapons, magic items, traps, maps and more! We hope the tales within will spark your enthusiasm for gothic horror and suspense, vengeful ghosts and terrifying witches

boardgame.name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Dungeons Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The quest that began in Across the Wastes continues in Dungeons Dark!

This new mission includes 4 scenarios that use a classic dungeon-style set-up. The rangers must explore the labyrinthine corridors and rooms of the dungeon, fighting monsters, dodging traps, and perhaps even finding a bit of treasure, in their bid to escape the dungeon and continue with their quest. The book also includes an extra scenario, should the rangers get captured, and a section on ‘shadow magic’, which the heroes can employ at their peril.
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Beholder Swamp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your friends have opted to head out and become heroes of the realm but all you have found currently is that your feet were soft. Coming to the crossroads a rather unusual fellow emerges from the bushes. Will he give you advice or cause you problems?

The scenario was designed for a quartet of first level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Triaina Strike Boat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Triania Strike Boat started as a hard hitting local defence boat, but was modified to have Jump capabilities. It has heavy armour, hard hitting weapons and can carry marines. It is usually carried to other systems by a Surma light carrier which then leaves. The Triainas complete their mission and make their own way home.
You get deck plans of the ship (including the sublight model), A3 deck plans and a scenario; Mission to Stavnii.

boardgame.name: Anderian Adventures: Removing the Veil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second in the series for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition, set in the Fantasy Kingdom of Anderia. First was the Ebony Box. In that adventure the characters recovered the Churches artefact. Once again the game is set in the isolated Town of Gengorge, where things got unreal. The characters are tasked with the rescue of the Mayors Son. Mayor Pearson Veil begs the characters to help him, he offers money or favours for the return of his son. Afterwards, chaos hits the town and the characters learn that the Box has more secrets than they thought.

The game is for a group of adventurers who are just starting out. 1st - 3rd Level. As the series progresses the characters will have the chance to make powerful allies and more than a few enemies too. Both Magick and ancient powers will come into play, as the group attempt to thwart the plot of a powerful mastermind, who calls himself 'The Master'. Hell-bent on bringing back something that should never have existed.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 15)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 15 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

Explore fantasy worlds and immersive adventures!

boardgame.name: Weird Warriors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Soldiers Strike!

Exposure to alien elements has always been a staple origin story for the mysterious powers and spectacular strength of great warriors, and if your hero is powered by eldritch radiations from aetherite to unobtainium, you can unleash a dozen awesome new options for your character with the Aether Soldier, Blue-Shifted, and Colossus alternate class features. Your enemies will fall before your telekinetic awakening, aetheric dynamism, kinetic deflection, and cerulean bloodrage!

boardgame.name: Jobs and Adventure Hooks for Space Freighter Campaigns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

LOAD UP THE SHIP AND LIFT BEFORE THEY GET HERE!

Everybody dreams of flying the Millennium Falcon, a Free Trader in the Imperium, or the Serenity, masters of where you go and what you do. Of course once mortgage payments on the ship come due, or you have to refuel, or the crew would like to eat, you’ll need to earn some money.

This Jobs and Adventure Hooks for Space Freighter Campaigns supplement is suitable for use with any far future/space opera style campaign. Using proven “Random Tables Technology”, all the important details of a cargo job, a passenger ticket or even a full charter of the ship can be defined quickly. Results are all system-less but can easily adapted to your campaign setting of choice. Any job can be made into an Adventure Hook by determining what role it plays in your planned adventures or the campaign world itself.

boardgame.name: The Art of Negotiation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Negotiation is a part of gaming that I’ve always felt was tough to do well. Whether you just wanted to haggle a little on the price of that +1 Longsword, plead your case in front of the King’s Judge, or bargain for your soul, there was always a potential conflict between what the rules said and what you wanted to decide for your character. Or the resolution was too brief. Or it was just down to a good or bad roll.

The Art of Negotiation is an optional rule subsystem for Savage Worlds Adventure Edition to make these situations fast, furious, and fun! It includes rules for performing negotiations, two new hindrances, two new edges and plenty of examples of ways you can use these negotiation rules. It replaces the Social Conflict rules in SWADE for those situations where more drama, stakes, and attention is warranted.

boardgame.name: Colonel Bull's Body
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’d have to be brave, foolhardy, or desperate to cross the Mississippi and enter the Ghost Lands. Perhaps your character is all three. When you learn that you’re named in the will of Colonel Horatio Bull, you can’t ignore it. Assembled with strangers from the fringe of society, your task is simple: divide up the inheritance among those who travel west and bring Colonel Bull’s body home.

Of course, you may face attacks by the Native nations, betrayal and double-dealing from other Easterners, and even the ghosts in the land will seek to teach you the error of your ways. Survive all that to reach the town of Blackwater and you might find Colonel Bull after all. Bringing his body home is another story...

Colonel Bull’s Body is an adventure for Seasoned Savage Worlds characters. The story is told in Dragonlaird Gaming’s Six Guns and Ghost Lands setting but can be used with other popular supernatural West Savage settings.

Ride hard and aim true!

boardgame.name: The Tiny Tome of Chivalry
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six new knightly orders, each with its own background, creation history, description, and combat stats for each knight rank.

boardgame.name: The Tiny Tome of Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tiny Tome of Dragons is a supplement for the 5th edition of the most popular role-playing game in the world that contains 6 new types of dragons divided into two families. Also, each of them is divided into 12 age categories.

Unlike the normal dragons of the 5th edition, I preferred to create 12 age categories for each of these new dragons, similar to those of previous editions, to have more options for challenge ratings. However, instead of filling the document with statblocks pages, I created a table for each dragon, also similar to the previous editions, but with the most necessary 5th edition stats.

Each dragon also includes its description, the history of where it came from, the description of its Combat style, Habitat/Society, and Ecology. In addition to a list of Actions, Legendary Actions, etc. each of which explains how to easily modify them depending on its age category.

New dragons in this supplement are:

Wilderness Spirit Dragons

Shadowtree Dragon
Wildfire Dragon
Cascade Dragon
Stellar Dragons

Quasar Dragon
Meteor Dragon
Supernova Dragon

boardgame.name: Warlock's Workshop
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Solo Adventure For One Daring Hero

For generations, treasure-hunters have sought in vain for the hidden workshop of the reclusive alchemist, Thesije.

Perhaps none of them had the directions you have discovered, to a cave a single day's journey from the caravanserai of Nept.

Will you be the one to claim the treasures and secrets so many have failed to find?

Warlock's Workshop is a rich and detailed supplement for The Fantasy Trip. The Fantasy Trip: In the Labyrinth is required to play.

boardgame.name: The Office of the Saint-Gerrin Ghost Hunters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Who you gonna call...?"

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of 3 levels of the headquarters of a ghost hunting team, with reception areas, workshops, sleeping quarters and a ghost vault.

boardgame.name: The Office of the Saint-Gerrin Ghost Hunters - Vault Breach
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"They're getting out!

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of 3 levels of the headquarters of a ghost hunting team, with reception areas, workshops, sleeping quarters and a ghost vault that has breached - ghosts are everywhere!

boardgame.name: The Wayward Spirit Coaching Inn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Rest the horses hear?"

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of 3 levels of a rural coaching in, with stables, carriage house, rooms and taproom.

boardgame.name: The Wayward Spirit Abandoned Urban Tavern
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The city grew up around the old rural tavern - and then left it behind"

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of 3 levels of an abandoned inn or tavern in a city setting

boardgame.name: Professor Shinkley's Hall of Fascinating Treasures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Oh yes, do come in and see our wonderful exhibits"

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of 3 levels of an urban museum, with natural history, ancient artefacts, armour, books and an art gallery

boardgame.name: The Bellow & Brew Pub
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dwarven Tavern and Forge!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x30 battlemap depicting a Dwarven tavern or inn, with it's own forge and blacksmith. Includes exterior version.

boardgame.name: The Wreck of the HLS Turnstone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Haunted by those that perished on board, beware those that tread the ruined gangways.

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Sci-Fi or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The ship occupies approximately 30x50 tiles.

Contents: A large haunted space hulk, damaged and ruined. Includes exterior version, non-haunted version, and black-surround alt interior.

boardgame.name: Seeker of Knowledge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The secret to what created the desert, and how to reverse it is hidden away at a long-abandoned remote monastery. Who knows what other ancient knowledge and treasure is hidden there?

Seeker of Knowledge can be used as an adventure in any campaign world, or played as a sandbox in Hellebarde's default setting. Written and tested with Castles and Crusades RPG, notes are provided for conversion to other OSR systems.

Seeker of Knowledge can be used stand-alone or as part of the Exterris Adventure Tome AT-5 (plus ONA-17 through ONA-20).

boardgame.name: SunDivers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sundiving. The interstellar sport that has audiences across the sector gripped!

Custom-made ships make high-speed dives into a star's atmosphere, with the lowest perigee winning. The championship moves from star to star, varying the risks. Its a dangerous sport, with plenty of shocks and fatalities.

Join the race. Get involved in the politics behind the sport. Or field your own team.

Includes:

An NPC Team
Deckplans of a typical sundiver ('Dynosoar')
History of the sport
Rules for carrying out a sundive

boardgame.name: The Temple of Set
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something foul is lurking beneath the sands of Aegypt, and a horror of the ancient world is about to be reborn

The Temple of Set is an adventure for experienced Rank 5 Mythras Classic Fantasy characters and takes place in the mysterious land of Aegypt, an ancient kingdom of vast deserts, soaring pyramids, and powerful magic. While investigating the disappearance of a nomad clan, the characters uncover a sinister plot that threatens all of Aegypt with unspeakable horrors. The stakes have never been higher as the adventurers face deadly foes in the city of Ombos, brave the haunted wasteland of the Firewind Desert, and finally confront the black evil that festers in the catacombs beneath the ruined temple.

boardgame.name: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy Turn Order Variant
boardgame.description: With this expansion, the player order is determined by the order the players passed on the previous round.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy Worlds Afar Collection
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy

boardgame.name: 100 Oddities for a Vampire Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to “100 Oddities for a Vampire Lair,” the seventeenth entry in Skirmisher Publishing’s popular and bestselling series of system-free sourcebooks dedicated to inspiring rich stories and spicing up encounter areas with exciting curiosities!

“100 Oddities for a Vampire Lair” draws on the long spanning multicultural tradition of Vampire myth-telling across the world and, of course, the plentiful body of literature and films that feature them. This supplement is dedicated to the places where Vampires lurk and focuses on the horrors that accompany the denizens of their lairs and provides enough detail on each to bring them to life (so to speak).

Oddities are designed to help storytellers make places in their scenarios as memorable as those that have appeared in innumerable sources like those mentioned above and to fascinate and engage characters and prompt them to ask questions like “Why is this thing here?”, “What is that for?”, or “Who would do something like this?” They are intended to aid creativity, to turn possibly bland areas or encounters into something more, and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone.

As with other “Oddities” volumes, all of the entries in this book can be used separately or in conjunction with one another to add evocative details to any sort of appropriate area or encounter and in any manner that suits the needs of a particular storyteller. “100 Oddities for a Vampire Lair” also includes a Random Coffin Contents table for when you need something special or particularly weird to fill a specific tomb or sepulcher.

boardgame.name: Thrones (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the thrones in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Thrones is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Thrones (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the thrones in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Thrones is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Thrones (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the thrones in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Thrones is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Thrones (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the thrones in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Thrones is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Mr. Husk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nothing but corn for miles

In the sleepy rural country side lies miles upon miles of corn fields. A singular farm lies on top of small hill, standing vigil over the corn. When your van breaks down and you find yourselves stranded in a sea of fields will the farm be a source of salvation or is there something other than the farm watching over the corn as well?

boardgame.name: The Life & Times of a Sell Sword Company aka All About Mercenaries (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mercenary companies. Whether their reputations are good, bad or truly evil, they are a major part of our fantasy worlds and the wars that are fought within them. They are a vital part of the game world itself.

So, then, why don’t we spend more time on them? Think about how much more fun it can be when you know their weapons, their tactics, even just their coat of arms. Bringing these exceptionally enjoyable NPCs to life continues to add to the campaigns. Whether they are allies, enemies or even employers, knowing more about the mercenaries of your world is going to make it better for players and GM!

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

This supplement contains 24 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 58 pages. If you haven’t taken a look at our Small Bites before, this is the perfect opportunity to give us a try! This is 24 pages of content for free. You will find dozens of ideas that spark your imagination, as well as entertain you!

boardgame.name: Facets of Wonder aka All About Precious Stones and their Magical Properties (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diamonds, emeralds, rubies, sapphires, and oh so many more! Their beauty is stunning, but their value is even more impressive. They are the kings of the loot pile for all the right reasons.

Whether found in a dragon’s hoard or a king’s crown jewels, gemstones fascinate adventurers and merchants alike. But in a fantasy game, do they hold more value than their worth in a piece of jewelry? Facets of Wonder not only details what the gems are worth and how they compare to each other, but it also describes the superstitions and fantasy magical powers of these magnificent rocks. This is the one supplement that will let you bring the fire and brilliance of gemstones into your game world in a big way. But we didn’t stop with gemstones! You will also find pearls, ivory, and other valuable stones, as well as a list of magical/mythical stones.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

This supplement contains 34 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 78 pages. If you haven’t taken a look at our Small Bites before, this is the perfect opportunity to give us a try! This is 34 pages of content for free. You will find dozens of ideas that spark your imagination, as well as entertain you!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Tundra/Grasslands Battlemat
boardgame.description:
This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The map is high-resolution with great color quality, making it one of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map Tundra terrain.

The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Secrets of Siege Magic aka All About Battle Magic for Castles & Sieges (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Castles. The ultimate symbol of might in a fantasy age. Massive piles of stone set to repel every imaginable attack. But what if there are wizards, and dragons, and giants? What do you do then?

Have you considered putting as much effort into defending these grand edifices against the magic of the enemy as you have about the enemies’ arrows? Why not? Are you going to let some simple sorcerer or warlock walk up to the castle it took generations to build and slip past its defenses with a spell any teenager could learn? Of course not! But how do you go about defending your castle against magic? Well, unintentionally (sort of) discussing how to protect the castle also gives the advice on how to attack one using magic, so this book really is about both the offense and the defense.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

This supplement contains 51 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 89 pages. If you haven’t taken a look at our Small Bites before, this is the perfect opportunity to give us a try! This is 51 pages of content for free. You will find dozens of ideas that spark your imagination, as well as entertain you!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Racice River Delta/Deployment Zone Battlemat
boardgame.description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Racice River Delta (Clan Smoke Jaguar) on one side and Deployment Zone on the other side.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Guild of Merchant Explorers
boardgame.description:
In The Guild of Merchant Explorers, each player starts with one city on their personal map board.

Shuffle the deck of terrain cards, then reveal most of these cards one by one. Based on the terrain revealed, each player places on their board cubes that are connected to their starting city or other cubes. You want to complete areas on your board, cross the seas to new land, and establish new cities on the board. You can explore capsized ships for treasure — which gives you special placement capabilities — and create linked connections between locations to score bonus points. Common objectives can be completed by all players, with those who complete it first scoring more points.

At the end of a round, all cubes are removed from each board, leaving only the cities behind, so if you don't establish new cities, you'll be stuck in the same places.

The Guild of Merchant Explorers contains multiple copies of four different maps, and the game is designed so that you can play remotely with one or more copies.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Chaos Campaign Succession Wars
boardgame.description:
Chaos Campaign: Succession Wars provides rules for selecting a force and embarking on a planetary assault mini-campaign, as well as tools to create campaigns of your own.

This module introduces Chaos Campaign play, which offers consequences between individual missions, a reason to chase down specific objectives while preserving your troops, and ways to improve your force as you progress.!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Personal Space: The Retreat Moon
boardgame.description:
The Retreat Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Retreat Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 11:00-12:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Reflection Rocks
Local Cuisine: Magical Acorns

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Badger Hawthorn
Falcon Starling
Hazel Emberly
Savannah Cornelia
boardgame.boardgameversion: English BGotMC edition with Badger Hawthorne
English BGotMC edition with Falcon Starling
English BGotMC edition with Hazel Emberly
English BGotMC edition with Savannah Cornelia

boardgame.name: BattleTech: House Arano The Aurigan Coalition
boardgame.description:
High Lady Kamea Arano led a rebellion, dispatched the usurpers who stole her throne, dismantled their dictatorial government, and restored peace to the Aurigan Coalition. Now her true battle begins…

The Arano Restoration has succeeded, and High Lady Kamea rules over the reunited Aurigan Coalition. But all is not well – the Coalition’s hardscrabble planets teeter on the brink of collapse, while its powerful neighbors await another chance to subvert House Arano. More than ever, the Coalition needs warriors willing to do whatever it takes to claim victory.

House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition brings the setting of the hit PC strategy game BattleTech into the long-running tabletop experience. Learn the proud history of the Coalition and its hope for the future, then take up the defense of the Arano dynasty with four all-new scenarios picking up where the game left off.

To survive on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, those of noble birth must once again call on champions of mercenary mind.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 108 - Nov/Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From the contents page

Freelance Traveller #108: Nov./Dec. 2021

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue (and all back issues) can be found on Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.

boardgame.name: Trolling for Trouble: Chain Devil
boardgame.description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Chain Devil. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the December 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 107 - Sep/Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
From the contents page

Freelance Traveller #107: Sep./Oct. 2021

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue (and all back issues) can be found on Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.

Doing It My Way: Quick Hiver Character Generation for Conventions

boardgame.name: The Hunt for Bread in October
boardgame.description:
Crisis in the Kremlin!

You are a Russian, a citizen of the new Republic. Gone forever are the days of Soviet Buracracy [sic] and waiting in Bread Lines.

Now with a Free Market Economy you wish you had those bread lines. Food is now a luxury item and a simple loaf of bread is hard to find and keep!

You are now on a Hunt for Bread in October!

Hunt for Bread in October is a fun and fast Micro Game for two or more players.

Bread Not Included!

—description from the publisher

A tongue-in-cheek tactical combat game where players fight over a loaf of bread. Each player controls a character represented by three randomly determined stats: Strength, Dexterity, and Stamina. The game is played on a square grid representing a bread shop. The basic object of the game is for the characters to beat the heck out of each other in an effort to obtain the bread and exit the bread shop.

To start the game, one player is selected at random to be in possession of the bread. The other players then set up their characters around the one with the bread. Starting with the player who has the bread, each player takes a turn consisting of movement and combat actions.

These turns continue until one player's character escapes with the bread, somebody flips over the game board, or everybody just gets tired of the silliness and moves on to a real game. Somewhat similar in spirit to the parody game Panzer Pranks, the emphasis of Bread in October appears to be on satire rather than simulation or playability.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Nations & Cannons Core Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1775. The spark of revolution has ignited in the thirteen colonies, and the British army is on its way to smother it. While the Redcoats mass in Boston, the 2nd Continental Congress has just formed a provisional government. Without help, the Patriots will surely fall to the British forces. Join the fight for liberty in this Revolutionary campaign setting!

Well researched and vigorously play tested, Nations & Cannons products are 5e compatible and introduce many new mechanics for historical realism in the world's most popular roleplaying game. The Core Rules include everything you need to play 18th century adventures, set during the American Revolution and beyond! Inside this book you'll find:


Six new human Roles; variant traits for a diverse party without fantastical races.
Detailed history of Heritages, covering the people and cultures of colonial America.
The new Firebrand class, a rabble-rouser whose pen is as mighty as their sword!
Six subclass options, from the cunning Marksman to the duplicitous Turncoat.
New backgrounds like the Son of Liberty, and flintlock feats to customize your character.
65 new items, from provisions and poisons to dueling pistols and pennsylvania rifles.
All-new rules for ordnance and working together as an Artillery crew to bombard your enemies.
A Wargear system to customize your loadout, and bring multiple firearms into battle!
Rules to replace spellcasting with clever tricks called Gambits, including 35 unique effects.
A roster of 25 Enemies, including soldiers, artillery pieces, cavalry, and wild beasts.
The Invasion of Canada, an introductory module covering the Patriots' first major offensive in 1775!


The stories covered in this book include diverse perspectives and a cast of unconventional heroes, who fought on and off the battlefield for liberty, equality, justice, and vengeance. Build your character, declare your allegiance, and explore the conflict that created a nation, all while immersed in the legends and history of the American Revolution.

boardgame.name: Class War: The Jacobin Board Game
boardgame.description:
Class War is the new two-player asymmetric strategy game from the team behind Jacobin, the largest socialist magazine in the United States.

In Class War, you are a collective entity: a social class — either the Capitalists or the Workers. You’ll fight for social dominance in an unstable constitutional democracy. Will the Capitalists crush this rising wave of popular discontent and entrench their position as masters of society? Or will the Workers triumph over the power of money to make society more equal and just?

In Class War, players draw cards from their decks and deploy them in society using the money they earn in the economy. The cards you’ve played will be used to mobilize dice (representing your social power) against your opponent — in the economy, to win a greater slice of the economic pie, or in the state, to elect figures who support your political agenda. Ultimately, both classes aim to make their demands into law, permanently changing the rules of the game in their favor.

boardgame.name: Chuck & Cover
boardgame.description:
From time to time differences must be settled by a duel. Hands will clash causing expected and unexpected events but if you use your wits, you can come out on top. Remember, strength in numbers can lead to victory.

Each player takes a card at random and places it on the table on the side of their choice. Each turn, at the count of 3, both players are going to chuck simultaneously revealing a number of fingers (1-4) on one hand. Once revealed, both numbers will be added together to form the Target Number. Each player will cover that number on their card, and use its special ability.

The game ends when a player is unable to cover the Target Number on their card. The other player is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Socks Monster
boardgame.description:
Compete to have the best stall with the best combination of monsters.

Socks Monster is a competitive game, in which we will have to take into account both sides of the cards: On one side we find the monsters and on the other the socks. The goal of the game is to finish with the most points at the end of the game, thanks to the connections of the socks and the bonuses of the monsters.

At the beginning of the game two cards are dealt to each player and with the remaining cards four equal draw decks are made showing the sides of the socks.

In turns, the player draws a card from any draw deck and then plays a card on the table. We must always start on our first turn with a monster and then follow the placement rules.

We will be playing cards forming our stall and making chains of socks to be able to lower other monsters. The socks are connected and superimposed following the placement rules and the requests of the monsters.

At the end of the game we will get points for the correct connections of the socks, the score bonuses of the monsters and we will subtract points for the stinky socks.

In addition, the game has a small variant, where the weather symbols come into play and add more interaction and bite to the game.

boardgame.name: Familiar Tales
boardgame.description:
Familiar Tales is a co-operative, deck-building, fantasy adventure for 1-4 players. It's an exciting narrative game in which players take on the roles of a wizard's familiars, entrusted with saving and raising a displaced princess. They must keep her safe from the evil forces that would see her dead, but when it comes to children, it is not enough to merely survive! The familiars know that every choice they make will affect the young one in their care. If they are victorious and the throne is reclaimed, what kind of woman will sit upon it?

Players will explore a massive world through the pages of a fantastical story book filled with branching paths and memorable characters. Fight off enemies, and explore the many nooks and crannies of an enchanted world. Experience a professionally narrated, fully scored, decade-spanning fantasy epic. Easily downloadable for both Mac and Windows, this browser-based app is required to play Familiar Tales. Think of it as an automated game master and storyteller! The app also features a digital, searchable rulebook.

An innovative card play system allows players to level up their familiars by building and customizing their skill decks. Players will use their skill cards to perform all manner of exciting actions throughout their campaign.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Viral Vegetable Wars
boardgame.description:
Hell in the Kitchen

Contaminated: It's a quiet night in a suburban home when something animates the vegetables and sends them on a war of extermination!

Viral Vegetable Wars is a fast Micro Game of combat on the move as Humans and Vegetables try to eliminate each other.

You can take back your home if you have the guts and the gun.


A Complete Micro Game
Fast & Inexpensive
Hours of Fun
Expandable
Bio-Degradable
Politically Incorrect
Dice Not Included


—description from the publisher

A wacky tactical wargame of humans fighting off animated vegetables seeking to escape from a household where the vegetables mysteriously sprang to life.

Designed to be played on a hex grid using counters, but the game can also be played directly on the tabletop. Each Human and Vegetable unit is rated for movement, attack, and defense. There are also weapons and other resource items that can be used to assist the Human player. Tri Tac's Bureau 13 can make a cameo appearance courtesy of an optional rule introducing those forces into the game.

The game portrays a battle to the death, where each side tries to eliminate the other. However, the humans can score a partial victory by getting the family into a car and escaping.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Land of Gods
boardgame.description:
The conflict between the gods has caused the creatures to be lost in another dimension, so the players have to attract them and form the most powerful pyramid. We will have to acquire the different types of creatures, magic, water, fire and plant that will help us achieve victory.

In Land of Gods, players will have the objective of forming the most powerful pyramid, as God you will have to attract creatures to your lands and combat them in the best possible way.

We will draw four environment cards that will become part of the objectives of the game and we will deal three cards to each player that will be taken to their hand and with the rest of the cards we make two equal decks with the creatures face up.

The turn of both players will be played at the same time, having to put into play a creature face down that will become part of the individual pyramid of each one.

The creature played will then be revealed and the type of the creature will be compared: The highest type on the reference card will win the trick. In the example, the water type card wins, since it is above the fire type on the scale.

The winner of the trick will be the first to choose a visible creature from the two draw decks, the other player must take the other deck.

In turn, each type of creature has an ability when played that can trigger different direct and optional effects.

Every time a turn ends we will check if someone completes an environment and at that moment they can claim it.

This is how the turns will go by, in which we will have to take into account the rules for placing the pyramid and also what the creatures themselves demand of us in order to activate their power-ups. In the conditions and enhancers, having a number of different creatures, adjacency of some specific type, that there are no fire creatures in our pyramid... the God that best combines his creatures and scores the most points, will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Les dfis du Pre Nol
boardgame.description:
In the North Pole, it’s the same story every year: Santa is trying to choose the best team of helpers on whom he will be able to count on to ensure the delivery of the presents during Christmas Night.

To select the best team, he relies on his companions to guide and lead some bold and daring elves through Santa’s 6 challenges. Each companion becomes head instructor for the elves. The aspiring elves’ ability in math, keen sense of observation, phonological awareness and general motor skills will be tried and tested. They will also be given the opportunity to demonstrate solidarity and kindness, two significant values in the North Pole...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Comme tous les ans, au pôle Nord, c’est la même histoire : père Noël cherche l’équipe de lutins sur laquelle il pourra compter pour l’aider à effectuer la livraison des cadeaux pendant la nuit de Noël.

Pour faire son choix, il compte sur ses acolytes pour guider et entraîner des lutins courageux à travers les 6 défis du père Noël. Chaque acolyte devient un maître entraîneur de lutin. Les aptitudes mathématiques, le sens de l’observation, la conscience phonologique et la motricité globale des aspirants lutins seront mis à l'entraînement. Ils auront aussi la chance de faire preuve d’entraide et de bienveillance, 2 valeurs très importantes au pôle Nord...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead
boardgame.description:
You are a nominee at the 67th Annual Music Awards! Unfortunately, you won't be winning anything tonight. Our host Mannie, America's Sweetheart Pop Star, is dead. We are asking that you remain in the green room for your safety. While there, try to open Mannie's purse to look for clues as to what went down at rehearsal that led to her murder.

Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of famous recording artists and work together to solve the mystery. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read social media posts and solve puzzles to unlock Mannie's purse, then figure out who murdered her!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Witches of Wickville
boardgame.description:
The Witches of Wickville are cursed! Every century, covens fight to be the first to complete the sacred ritual of the Grimoire. If you defeat the other witches OR summon your Guardian, you will break the curse, but if you fail, your coven will be banished to the shadows until the next ritual.

In Witches of Wickville, a game of witches in which from 1 to 4 players we can face each other to win the victory. The objective of the game is to be the first to light our candles to activate the ritual and wake up our guardian or we can also win by defeating the enemy by throwing the three cursed potions at him.

At the beginning of the game, the players choose a witch from each team who will represent their character during the game.

Then we place both guardians in the center of the table on their inactive side, shuffle the rest of the witchcraft cards and place them randomly on their inactive side, forming a circle around the guardians.

The game will take place in turns, in which we will have a compulsory action and two optional ones.

We must always move and optionally we can flip a card and/or use our character's ability.

Every time we flip a card, the cards activate an ability that must be executed, that card can produce chain effects, flip the next card, deactivate a specific card... and so on.

The first player to have all four candles lit and the grimoire book on the side of his color will activate his guardian, lighting his four candles a second time will make him the winner of the ritual.

But beware! With the yellow potions, if you throw all three potions you will damage the opposing witch, if you do it a second time, it will be another way to defeat him and win.

boardgame.name: Mageling: Rise of the Ancient Ones
boardgame.description:
Enemies of the Evertree have rallied behind the Cult of Asdea: An insidious force, that will stop at nothing to break open the void, and unleash Asdea, devourer of life, upon the world. Should Asdea awaken, her festering hunger will spare no being. The Evertree is not yet strong enough to defend its people, and so once again all hope turns to the Magelings! With the teachings of moth-mage Theone to guide them, they must enter the dark wilds of Shada Swamp. There, through the mist of the Green Veil, the damp of the Fungal Bog, and the dangers of the Tellurian Ruins, they will root out the forces of Asdea. Perhaps they will even face the Ancient One herself...

Mageling: Rise of the Ancient Ones is no game of chance. It will take wise use of your scrolls, your potions, your mana, and your mageling’s powers to snatch victory from between Asdea’s jaws. Do not despair— though the road may be hard, this is still a world worth saving! Rise to the challenge, magelings!

Mageling, bring your hope, your determination, and your skill; but beware. The Ancient Ones rise.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Candies for Cthulhu
boardgame.description: Candies for Cthulhu is a printable Roll & Write in which the Cthulhu gang has become addicted to sugar and will attack on Halloween all the houses that do not have supplies of sweets, that is why we must deliver the different packages of sweets and protect all the houses in our neighborhood.

boardgame.name: The Clinic: Are You Mad?
boardgame.description:
The Clinic is a psychological quiz game based on celebrity and popular culture, ideally for use as a party game.

The Clinic's gameplay is similar to psychological profile quizzes found in magazines, where players answer a series of multiple choice questions and eventually arrive at a set psychological profile at the end.

The game's name and theme comes from the UK media obsession with fame, celebrity, and the pressures of being in the spotlight, as illustrated by publications such as Heat (magazine), OK!, Hello! and similar. It seeks to play on the notion that any normal person can be thrust into the limelight via reality and talent shows such as Big Brother or The X Factor.

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn Molten Gold Foiled
boardgame.description:
Foiled version for Molten Gold.
Available in the Organized Play Kit 1 for Ashes Reborn.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: War on High
boardgame.description:
It's the last place you'd think would erupt into violence as the forces of Evil begin their last attempt to take Heaven.

War on High is a fast Micro Game of combat on the move as two or more players fight the final war of Armageddon and try to eliminate each other.

You can Storm or Protect Heaven if you have the skill and the Courage!


A Complete Micro Game
Fast & Inexpensive
Hours of Fun
Expandable
Bio-Degradable
Politically Incorrect
Dice Not Included


No. Don't look for intellectual content or deep meanings in these cheap games.

—description from the publisher

An offbeat (to say the least) tactical wargame of conflict between the forces of Heaven and Hell. Hellspawn are fighting to occupy the heavenly throne while the forces of Heaven will prevail if they can seal off the pit leading to Hell - this is done with a "plug" that is represented by one of the game's counters.

While War on Heaven was designed to be played on a hex grid using counters, the game can also be played directly on the tabletop. Each Heaven and Hell unit is rated for movement, attack, and defense.

Optional rules allow the forces of Tri Tac's Bureau 13, who are heavily armed with firearms and an anti-tank rocket, to make a cameo appearance in the battle.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Gataria
boardgame.description:
Nyx is a cat who lives with Petunia, the cutest apprentice witch you have ever seen, and they take care of each other, along with doing a lot of trickery. Nyx is getting old, though, and preparing to retire, so Petunia will be need of a new companion soon! That's why they're looking to adopt a new kitten to learn all about being a witches' cat!

Each player controls a magic copy of a cat, who will try to showcase their skills to either reach the tower at the center of the board or capture 3 cats from other players.

Every turn they will place their movement tile on the table and, in ascending order, jump to an adjacent roof with the same color or number. They can also use magic portals to navigate from one edge to another. If at any point they meet another cat, this one will be captured unless they yield a treat to distract!

Petunia also offers treats that can be traded for attack, defense and trick cards, or by keys to the tower. At the end of every round, one of the players moves Nyx, shattering a roof and creating new portals and connections!

boardgame.name: ARK - Fjordur
boardgame.description: Fjordur is a free, official, non-canonical DLC expansion map.

boardgame.name: Warsemble
boardgame.description:
Warsemble is a turn-based strategy game for two to four players. The rules of the game allow for different situational games in which the target, the size of the field, and the size of the armies can vary.

There are only three rules in Warsemble (movement, rest, and battle), which reflect principles of actual military action:

The game is played in turns. With each turn, the player can move or update all figures.


Movement: Figures can move in four directions (forward, backward, left, and right) to adjacent accessible squares. Each time a figure enters a new square, its strength is reduced by points equal to the effort value of the square. Within each turn, the figure can be moved to as many positions as its strength allows.



Rest: Each figure that stays in place and is not attacked increases its strength by one point each turn, until it reaches a maximum strength of six.



Attack: The attacking figure must enter the square of the opponent figure, following the rules of movement (i.e., it must expend the strength needed to enter the opponent's square). After moving, the strengths of the two figures are compared and the stronger of the two survives.


The game is won by the player who first brings the crown to the base.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mec Squash
boardgame.description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping machines down to the planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the damage to their robots from the blue-white sun. The robots soon began battling each other as well as the monsters.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company began sponsoring contests for engineers to build specialized combat robots.

With orbital and ground monitors it became the new spectator sport of the 23rd century.

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own combat robots from clay then assign the game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, flight capability, and head and body styles. Then fight out a battle on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and power cells.

—user summary

Japanese Monster Squash

The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a lot of years of planning, they began dropping the ultimate biological weapon down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

boardgame.name: People Squash
boardgame.description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited.

After a few years of planning, they began dropping Mecs and a host of other creatures and life forms to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

But this failed also and the company that would call the planet their own, decided on a final course of action. The next step was to create a vast army of high level executives and decision makers that had decided to colonize this awful place.

Like everything else tried on this arm pit of the Galaxy, the plan backfired.

The people dropped on Blorb began to attack everything, including themselves, as they mutated into new and even more bizarre forms.

EPILOGUE

From sea to scummy sea, Blorb 212 became a littered junk yard of dead MONSTERS, MECS, BUGS, MUTANTS, and PEOPLE. The monsters still hunted the world but many had talked to the human invaders. It was hard, but they realized what was at the root of their problem. Now, with their friends, the Humans, they would someday get even with the corporation who created this mess.

As the battles continued, they plotted...

—description from the publisher

In this installment, you sculpt your own human figurines from clay. Next, assign the figures game characteristics for "armor," movement, and weaponry. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include advanced weapons, initiative, and terrain.

boardgame.name: Bug Squash
boardgame.description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping Mecs down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

boardgame.name: Dauercamper, Dosenbier und eine Leiche
boardgame.description:
All hell breaks loose on the campsite at Teufelssee! The owner Gisela Nickel was murdered - at the end of the autumn festival of the permanent campers, of all things.

Story

The smell of steaks and bratwurst was in the air. Now that the vacation season was coming to an end and the last tourists had left, the campsite at Teufelssee was once again firmly in the hands of the few loyal permanent campers. At the joint autumn festival, numerous homemade salads were dished up to say goodbye to the summer with beer and sausage. Together they ate and drank extensively and reminisced.

The party should have been the prelude to the quiet and relaxing half of the camper year. But what was meant to be a celebration took a dramatic turn during the evening when the campground's grumpy, chain-smoking owner, Gisela Nickel, was found dead in the reception area. How could this celebration have ended so fatally?

Players

4 female and 4 male roles (with 8 people). Male roles can be played by women and vice versa.

—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Murder Mystery Games (Culinario Mortale Inc.)

boardgame.name: The Venom of Yara'Raka
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Venom of Yara’Raka is an adventure designed for a mediator and three to six players, with an average duration of three hours. It includes six pre-generated player characters.

The rancher Carlos Ribeiro, forced out by the Governor’s decree and after considerable losses amongst the cane fields, quickly hired some brave adventurers to escort him and his cattle to the fertile grazing lands of Pituaçu. The way is hard and dangerous. Marta Ribeiro, the rancher’s wife, is afraid about the journey because they are bringing their newborn son. Oyapó, the expedition's Tupinambá guide, has guaranteed that the Pituaçu region is ideal pasture land and will be a good place to settle down.

The journey is hard, but things get even harder when little Oyapó is kidnapped, and your adventurers must confront a supernatural menace to rescue him!

boardgame.name: Wild Men In Casmir's Mill
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:
Bigfoot is coming out of the woods...

The harvest season is come.

It should be a time of sweat and singing and joy.

But howls sound at night, and the old folks whisper about the Wild Ones,

who chatter amidst the trees and dance on the roof at night. Rocks fly at

merchants, and on nearby paths lie smashed and twisted household gods.

The Wild Men have come to Casmir’s Mill, and each night they draw nearer.

Wild Men in Casmir's Mill is a wilderness investigatory adventure written for levels 1-3. In the adventure, the players are sucked into the plight of an isolated little region under siege by the huge and hairy Wild Men of the Wood. What begins as a simple investigation and straightforward protection of the critical grain harvests becomes an urgent race against time as servants of the Old Faith seek to summon a dire avatar of their long vanished gods, while the savage Wild Men lose their patience and make ready to attack.

boardgame.name: The Romanian Imperative
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fly the Deadly Skies!

It is February 1941 and after the fall of Tobruk in January, Churchill boldly tells the US: “Give us the tools, and we will finish the job."

Meanwhile, in Romania, a rather unusual occurrence attracts the attention of Section M. In the remote mountains near the village of Zaltan, a prototype Zeppelin named the Huginn has appeared, hovering over the ruins of an ancient castle. The tell tale blue glow of its engines and wolf’s paw insignia, a sure fire indication of the presence of Nachtwölfe.

Rogue Nachtwölfe engineer Johannes Vester has been convinced that a centuries-old legend about a Baron who discovered magical sapphires in the mine beneath the castle a motherload of prized Blauer Kristall awaits, ample fuel to power his nightmare experiments.

Section M quickly dispatches a team to reach these remote mountains to investigate.

But things are rarely as simple as they seem in the Secret War and the agents must observe, gain information, overcome foes both mortal and uncanny and ultimately thwart Nachtwölfe’s plans by eliminating the threat of the Huginn by any means necessary.

Just another standard day at the office then…


The Romanian Imperative is a 32-page PDF adventure for 4-6 agents, and comes with both full colour and printer friendly versions.
Features an intriguing mission which requires a mix of skills including exploration, stealth and combat.
A fascinating adventure on an often forgotten front, which can be run as a one-off or easily incorporated into an ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Under The Gun
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dover, June 1940. After decisive defeat in the Battle of France, German forces hover poised a mere 20 miles away across the English Channel. Artillery is rushed to the Dover area, and shelters and bunkers are dug into the famous White Cliffs. Then, beneath the town, a strange discovery is made.

Buried within the cliffs of 100-million-year old chalk lie the remains of an unusual building. The landing-ground for Romans, Saxons, Normans, and countless other invaders throughout history, the Kent coast is no stranger to antiquities. An archaeologist is dispatched from Cambridge University to evaluate the find.

But this is a structure like no other and it contains a deeper mystery, whose truth is better concealed from an already nervous British public. Section M dispatches agents to investigate, but can they uncover the truth underlying this ancient site and will they survive the dramatic conclusion to a shadowy drama which is played out Under the Gun?

• Under the Gun is a standalone 15-page adventure for Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20 for 4-6 agents.
• Explore an ancient mystery buried deep within the iconic white cliffs of Dover and unearth an artefact millennia old.
• Offers a mix of classic investigation, exploration and combat to suit all play styles!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Record Sheets Succession Wars
boardgame.description:
BattleTech Record Sheets: Succession Wars offers players the record sheets for all the 'Mechs detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: Succession Wars, 290 in total.

Note: These are selections from several other products. The selected entries in this PDF are reprinted--albeit with the current BattleTech logo--from Record Sheets: 3039 Unabridged, Record Sheets: 3050 Upgrade Unabridged-Clan & Star League, Record Sheets: 3058 Unabridged, and Record Sheets: 3075 Unabridged. Players who own those Record Sheets products will find the same units presented in Record Sheets: Succession Wars
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Dig, Defend or Die
boardgame.description:
Stotzing was not an easy planet to settle. The first colony, Eisenstadt, failed after less than a decade and its location was lost to historians for almost five centuries. The final throes of The Jihad caused the announcement of the discovery to be relegated to the small number of archaeologists and historians interested in lost colonies. But there was one other group that caught wind of this discovery—the Green Ghosts

Dig Defend or Die was the 2018 BattleTech World Wide Event depicting the clash between the Green Ghosts and the First Marik Defenders. Includes the Total Warfare and Alpha Strike scenario as well as the final results of the event.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Mercenaries Cards
boardgame.description: Alpha Strike Mercenaries Cards includes 36 double-sided (72 units) cards with all the game stats player need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in a wide variety of eras. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Kurita Cards
boardgame.description: Alpha Strike Kurita Cards includes 36 double-sided cards (72 units) with all the game stats player need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in a wide variety of eras. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

boardgame.name: Barrage: The GiftForge Insert
boardgame.description:
The package includes 10 action space covers (5 for base game and 5 for expansion). These can be used for 2 or 3 player games to replace unused workers.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 30 cm x 21,3 cm x 8 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood
boardgame.description:
This isn't the first time that BJ has visited Castle Wolfenstein. In 1946, he and Agent One, Richard Wesley, successfully infiltrated the fortress. The objective was simple; grab some intel and get out. What they discovered within the walls of the Castle were unspeakable horrors.
Start your campaign in Castle Wolfenstein and find a way to escape while Rudi Jäger is on your back! Navigate through the streets of Wulfburg and discover what the Nazis are secretly working on!

Wolfenstein: The Old Blood offers players four new scenarios that make up a closed prequel campaign with five new hero cards (and minis) and the ability to control your own Mech. It includes two new bosses (The Monstrosity and Rudi Jäger) and three new enemy types that come in two different variants each.
