boardgame.name: Never Sleep Again
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wes’ Arcade has always been the hottest hangout for teens in Elm Haven. But when a cursed video game machine shows up overnight and robs them of their ability to sleep, their nightmares begin to enter the waking world. The dream curse travels from the arcade to the roller rink and beyond as people start dying and the town learns they can never sleep again. Unless someone can beat the game...

This adventure is written as system agnostic and can be run with your favorite game system. Also included are pre-made characters with system agnostic "stats" that are easy to translate into your preferred system.

boardgame.name: Lindisfarne Monastery
boardgame.description:
Lindisfarne Monastery is a competitive euro-style dice worker placement game about monks working at a Christian monastery in the early Medieval period. Inspired by the real monastery of Lindisfarne, players work to create resources, feed themselves, and write religious texts for the library, culminating in the great Lindisfarne Gospels.

The monks are represented by dice, and the pips on the dice represent their level of experience. As the monks are placed on action spaces each round, their pips are converted to action points to spend in that action space. Each round, the player who has pip majority in each action space may claim an available bonus, which may include the ability to pip up a die.

Monks can also be sent in pilgrimage to holy sites overseas, and to collect rare, vivid inks to take home for use in their scriptorium. The monks must also beware the Vikings, who raid the monastery every summer, and who must be paid off in beer and mead, lest they steal the treasures of the monastery or murder the monks!

A full game of Lindisfarne Monastery is played over four game rounds, representing calendar years, where in each year there are two action phases, and within each action phase the monk dice are placed, and then resolved. Points are scored from pilgrimage, from writing religious texts, commissioning treasures for the monastery chapel, and for retiring monk dice from the board. The player with the highest total score at the end of the game is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Twilight: 2000 Dice Set
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

These engraved custom dice are designed specifically for the fourth edition of the Twilight: 2000 roleplaying game. The set includes:


Four base dice – one each of D6, D8, D10 and D12.
Four D6 ammo dice.
One D6 hit location die.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 186 cards; 45 per player color, plus 6 checkpoint cards.

boardgame.name: Cards Against Humanity: Climate Catastrophe Pack
boardgame.description:
It’s 2021, and humanity is broken. The world cannot get its shit together to do anything about climate change. That’s why Cards Against Humanity is convening a historic summit of world leaders releasing a pack of funny cards.

The Climate Catastrophe Pack comes with 30 new cards about how fucked we are. 100% of the profits will go to the Coalition for Rainforest Nations to stop deforestation — one of the most cost-effective ways to fight climate change. The pack also includes thousands of tree seeds you can plant to assuage your feelings of powerlessness while civilization collapses around you.

boardgame.name: Floriferous: Early Spring Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Early Spring Mini Expansion introduces 3 new action cards in each player color. These single-use cards introduce ways to switch cards around in the garden and look at face-down cards. Enjoy the new strategies in your floriferous garden!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Neuroriders
boardgame.description:
We're a group of neuroscientists specializing in degenerative brain diseases. We're implementing new technology for preserving memories in our patients. This amazing invention is the nanobots called "Neuroriders"

Neuroriders is a tile-laying game where the players will be traveling around the brain looking for the right amount of data they can take care of. To achieve this goal, they have to connect doors and avoid getting caught by crystalized areas.

boardgame.name: Klick-Klock
boardgame.description:
A new pencil-and-paper game for one or two players.

Taking turns, players draw straight lines on a grid of n × n dots, with n ≥ 3. Each line must connect at least 3 dots, all adjacent. From the second move, each line that is drawn must contain exactly one dot from the previous line. Lines may not be partially or totally overlapping. On each turn, and after having drawn a line, the player has the option of removing a free dot from the grid—that is, a dot that is not part of any line.
The player who makes the last move wins.

Published in Decemeber 2021 issue of Games World of Puzzles Magazine

boardgame.name: WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria
boardgame.description:
"WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria" is a strategy wargame where players deploy, maintain, and mobilize a medieval fantasy army against one another. The alignment system presents challenging decisions to the players, which will affect the loyalty of their units, and the leadership of their warlord. Units without loyalty are susceptible to leaving your army; or worse, they can be persuaded to join an opponent's. There is no randomness; players must out-think their opponents to achieve one of 3 victory conditions.

To achieve victory, a player must satisfy any one of the below conditions:

Be the last player with a surviving warlord and war camp.
If your warlord is killed, you lose the game.
If your war camp is destroyed, you lose the game.

Protect a Settlement until it grows to level 6.
If the dragon arrives, when it reaches the End of Game event, have the largest army size (IE: victory points).


When a game is fully set up and ready to start, the gameplay runs through a cycle of game rounds until one player wins the game, claiming victory over their opponents. A game round consists of a series of ordered turn handling for the deployed and enabled units, settlements, and war camps; followed by the handling of various ordered events. The next game round starts after all aforementioned game objects have completed their respective turns, and each ordered event has been handled. To assist with tracking and management of a game round an Initiative Table is used to indicate which in-game object’s turn must be handled next. Players only take their turn when one of their owned & controlled in-game object's are designated to take their respective turn. This cycle of starting and ending game rounds proceeds until a player achieves a victory condition, or the game reaches its final round triggering the End of Game event.

In WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria each player selects a single warlord from a pool of warlords for which to start their war campaign with. Afterwards, in the same order, all players select their starting war camp and warlord location on the battle map. Once war camp and warlord placement is complete; players are given their starting 100 gold, warbanner & protection markers, and the paired universal rules and abilities reference cards. The game can now begin, starting with the player whose warlord has the lowest initiative score indicated on the initiative table. As each round progresses, players will spend their gold to deploy and maintain various units that make up their army. Players will interact with settlements in one of 2 ways, in order to generate additional gold for their warfund.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Age of Steam: Osaka
boardgame.description:
This expansion puts players as the presidents of comedian training schools in Osaka. Each color of cubes represents a different type of comedy, and the black cubes represent the staff.

If cubes are delivered and there is not staff present to support the show, less income is received. Additionally, extra money can be received if the performer can enjoy the camaraderie of other performers in their niche along the way.

The map includes 2 new actions and special rules for 2-players.

boardgame.name: Pictures from Phandelver
boardgame.description:
"Collection of pictures from all NPC's from the Lost Mine of Phandelver, as a visual aid for your campaing.

37 png images of NPC's including their name and races, you can either print them or use them online."

(Author's Summary)

boardgame.name: La Maldicin: Hroes de Lorthar Despertar de las Razas: Mazo de Expansin
boardgame.description:
Despertar de las Razas is the first expansion of the game La Maldicin: Hroes de Lorthar.

This is an expansion of 50 new cards for the base game, including new and effective cards, as well as 4 new heroes, increasing the round limit to a total of 12 players.

Addition of new game modes:


Purgatory: A time trial mode where discard speed will be the only way to survive (ideal for multi-player games).



Camaradas: A 2v2 duel, where the duo that best manages to combine their cards and trust each other will win.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat Bundle
boardgame.description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with these two 36" x 36" custom playmats that can be used separately or combined into one massive combat arena!

This bundle includes:

Playmat #1 - The asphalt combat arena, which comes with 30 game cards and a rule sheet
Playmat #3 - The off-road arena

boardgame.name: Western Legends: Wooden Organizers
Western Legends: Wooden Travelling Trader + General Store + Trading Post Larger Than Sleeves Edition
boardgame.description:
There is no non-Larger Than Sleeves edition for this addon and LTS is the new standard size.

These stands have extra width (18-24mmm) to accommodate the extra length needed for most sleeves.

These new wooden stores will NOT fit in the box with the original insert. The extra length would run into the divider. You could remove the cardboard insert and rearrange your cards to accommodate the stores though.

Includes:
- Wooden Trading Post (LTS edition) (75 g, 22×11 cm ziploc bag, 2 cm thick)
- Wooden Traveling Trader (LTS edition) (75 g, 22×11 cm ziploc bag, 2 cm thick)
- Wooden General Store (LTS edition) (140 g, 41×12 cm ziploc bag, 1 cm thick)

The Trading Post and Traveling Trader stands are identical; it's just a matter of choosing the facing of the labelling piece.
